intro: Astracantha bienerti, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and birds. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a hairy texture. Astracantha bienerti is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
